articles.author: Ben Kew
articles.title: Report: Venezuelan Regime ‘Bribe List’ Includes College Degrees, Wiping of Criminal Records
articles.description: Government officials in Venezuela offer a bribe menu that allows people to purchase anything from a university degree to a wiping of their criminal record, according to a Bloomberg report published Tuesday.
articles.content: The list of available bribes is reportedly making its way around WhatsApp. Citizens can allegedly buy a $4,500 passport or pay $400 for a Chilean visa, $7,000 to wipe a criminal record, and $100 for the stamp that certifies university diplomas. The restaurant… [+2235 chars]

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: GOP’s H-2B Expansion Gives Business Unlimited Supply of Foreign Workers
articles.description: A plan to massively expand the importation of low-skilled foreign workers to the United States would allow American businesses to hire an unlimited number of foreigners instead of American citizens.
articles.content: Every year, the U.S. companies are allowed to import 66,000 low-skilled H-2B foreign workers to take blue-collar, non-agricultural jobs. The H-2B visa program is used by businesses to bring in cheaper, foreign workers and has contributed to blue-collar Americ… [+2737 chars]

articles.author: Frances Martel
articles.title: NGO Reports Widespread Torture in ‘Open-Air Concentration Camp’ Venezuela
articles.description: The research center CASLA Institute debuted a new report on the systematic use of torture in Venezuela at the Organization of American States (OAS) on Wednesday, documenting over 100 cases of the state torturing political dissidents in 2018 alone.
articles.content: The report is the latest in a string of similar studies spanning the entirety of the Maduro regime finding that the socialist regime of dictator Nicolás Maduro uses beatings, rape, psychological torture, and electrocution on individuals arrested for failure t… [+5014 chars]

articles.title: Delingpole: The National Climate Assessment Is a National Joke
articles.description: The National Climate Assessment has been out nearly a week and the verdict is in: everyone, but everyone – apart from the Obama holdovers who wrote it and the gullible reporters at CNN, the New York Times and CBS who bigged it up – has recognised it for what …

articles.author: AWR Hawkins
articles.title: Homeowner Shoots, Kills Intruder Five Years After Shooting Intruder at Same Address
articles.description: A homeowner in Tulsa, Oklahoma, shot and killed an intruder Tuesday just over five years after he shot another intruder at the same address.
articles.content: On November 27, 2018, Breitbart News reported that the homeowner, Charles Sweeney, shot and killed an intruder in the bathroom of his home. Fox 23 reports that the deceased intruder’s name was Donald Stovall. Tulsa World quoted Capt. Karen Tipler, who said, “… [+996 chars]

articles.author: John Binder
articles.title: Trump Pushes for Only One Fifth of Border Wall Funding
articles.description: President Trump is pushing the Republican-controlled Congress to approve only a fifth of the money needed to build his $25 billion border wall, all of which is currently tied to a slew of open borders provisions.
articles.content: In an interview with Politico, Trump said he would be “willing” to shut down the federal government if a Department of Homeland Security (DHS) funding bill does not include a measly $5 billion for his proposed wall along the U.S.-Mexico border. “I am firm,” T… [+2187 chars]

articles.author: Nate Church
articles.title: San Diego Businessman Hands Out $1,000 Checks at Wildfire-Damaged School
articles.description: San Diego real estate developer and restaurant owner Bob Wilson personally distributed the checks to students and faculty alike on Tuesday.
articles.content: “Let them figure out what they want to do with it,” Wilson told CNN affiliate KHSL. “Maybe they’ll help their family, maybe they want to buy gasoline for their car, maybe they want to buy a bicycle, it’s up to them.” All told, he offered 980 checks to student… [+1096 chars]

articles.title: Anne Hathaway: 'My Country Gassed Children'
articles.description: Actress Anne Hathaway expressed alarm over the situation at the southern border, claiming in an Instagram post that U.S. Customs and Border Protection agents “gassed” migrant children as hundreds of caravan members rushed toward San Diego port of entry.
